question.text: The correct statement of cleavage in humans is

options.text: It is a process to convert zygote to gastrula.
It starts while the fertilized egg is in fallopian tube.
It is identical to normal mitosis.
It starts when the egg reaches the uterus.

solution.text: Fusion of the sperm with the ovum is known as fertilization and it occurs at the ampullary-isthmic junction of the fallopian tube. The division of the zygote known as cleavage begins in the isthmus of the fallopian tube and the zygote moves towards the uterus while the division continues forming 2, 4, 8, 16 daughter cells called blastomeres. The zygote with 8-16 cells is called a morula. During cleavage the number of chromosomes in the daughter cells is same but the amount of cytoplasm is reduced. Hence it is not identical to mitosis
